alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Haralson and west central Carroll Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Waco, or 8 miles south of Buchanan, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bremen, Tallapoosa, Mount Zion, Waco, John Tanner State Park and Bowdon Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
